arabicText: وَأَمَّا عَادٌۭ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍۢ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Aur	rahe	Āad	woh	halāk	kiye	gaye	nihayat	sakht	garajti	āañdhi	se.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rahe	Āad	woh	halāk	kiye	gaye	nihayat	sakht	garajti	āañdhi	se

arabicText: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍۢ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًۭا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
He	forced	it	upon	them	with	strength,	consecutively	for	seven	nights	and	eight	days	-	so	you	
would	see	those	people	overthrown	in	it,	like	trunks	of	date	palms	fallen	down.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	un	par	quwwat	se	laga	di	sāt	Rāteiñ	aur	āath	din	laga-tār	to	un	logoñ	ko	un	meiñ	dekho:	
pichrde	(Mare)	huwe	goya	woh	khajoor	ke	dand	(Sookhe	tane)	haiñ	gire	huwe.

englishTranslationText: So	do	you	see	any	survivor	among	them?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	bacha	huwa	dekhte	ho?

arabicText: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
englishTranslationText:
And	Firaun,	and	those	before	him,	and	the	
dwellings	that	were	inverted	and	thrown,	
had	brought	error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	fir'aun	aur	us	se	agle	ulatne	wāli	
bastiyāñ	khatā	lāaye

arabicText: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةًۭ رَّابِيَةً
englishTranslationText:
They	therefore	disobeyed	the	Noble	
Messengers	of	their	Lord	–	so	He	seized	
them	with	an	intense	seizure.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unhoñ	ne	apne	Rab	ke	Rasooloñ	ka	
ḥukm	na	mānā	to	us	ne	unheiñ	badhi	
chadhi	girift	se	pakda.

arabicText: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	when	the	water	swelled	up,	We	
boarded	you	onto	the	ship.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		jab	pāni	ne	sar	uthāya	tha	ham	ne	
tumheiñ	kashti	meiñ	sawār	kiya

arabicText: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةًۭ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌۭ وَٰعِيَةٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
In	order	to	make	it	a	remembrance	for	you,	
and	in	order	that	the	ears	that	store	may	
remember.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	usey	tumhāre	liye	yād-gār	kareñ	aur	
isey	mehfooz	rakhe	woh	kān	ke	sun	kar	
mehfooz	rakhta	ho

arabicText: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌۭ وَٰحِدَةٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	the	Trumpet	will	be	blown,	with	a	
sudden	single	blow.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jab	Soor	phooñk	diya	jāye	ek	dum.

arabicText: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	earth	and	the	mountains	will	be	
lifted	up	and	crushed	with	a	single	crush.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	aur	pahād	utha	kar	daf'atan	
choora	kar	diye	jayeiñ

englishTranslationText:
So	that	is	the	day	when	the	forthcoming	
event	will	occur.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	din	hai	ke	ho	padegi	woh	hone	wāli

englishTranslationText:
And	the	heaven	will	split	asunder	-	so	on	
that	day	it	will	be	unstable.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	āasmān	phat	jāyega	to	us	din	uska	
patla	hāl	hoga

arabicText: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ ثَمَـٰنِيَةٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	angels	will	be	on	its	sides;	and	on	
that	day,	eight	angels	will	carry	the	Throne	
of	your	Lord	above	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	firishte	uske	kināroñ	par	khade	hoñge	
aur	us	din	tumhāre	Rab	ka	‘arsh	apne	ūpar	
āath	firishte	uthayeñ	ge

arabicText: يَوْمَئِذٍۢ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
On	that	day	all	of	you	will	be	brought	forth,	
so	none	among	you	wishing	to	hide	will	be	
able	to	hide.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	din	tum	sab	pesh	hoge	ke	tum	meiñ	koi	
chhupne	wāli	jān	chhup	na	sakegi.

arabicText: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
englishTranslationText:
So	whoever	is	given	his	book	in	his	right	
hand	-	he	will	say,	“Take,	read	my	account!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	woh	jo	apna	Nāma-e-A’amāl	dehne	hāth	
meiñ	diya	jāyega	kahega	lo	mere	Nāma-e
A’amāl	padho

englishTranslationText: “I	was	certain	that	I	will	confront	my	account.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mujhe	yaqeen	tha	ke	maiñ	apne	hisāb	ko	
pahuñchooñ	ga

englishTranslationText: He	is	therefore	in	the	desired	serenity.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	man	mānte	chain	meiñ	hai

englishTranslationText: In	a	lofty	Garden	–
romanUrduTranslationText: Buland	bāgh	meiñ

englishTranslationText: The	fruit	clusters	of	which	are	hanging	down.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jiske	khoshe	jhuke	huwe

arabicText: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
englishTranslationText: “Eat	and	drink	with	pleasure	–	the	reward	of	what	you	sent	ahead,	in	the	past	days.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Khāo	aur	piyo	rachta	huwa	sila	uska	jo	tum	ne	guzre	dinon	meiñ	āage	bheja

arabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	is	given	his	book	in	his	left	hand	-	he	will	say,	“Alas,	if	only	my	account	were	not	
given	to	me!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	apne	nāma-e	a’amāl	bayeiñ	hāth	meiñ	diya	jāyega	kehega	hāaye	kisi	tarah	mujhe	apna	
nawishta	(Nāma-e	A’amāl)	na	diya	jāta.

englishTranslationText: “And	had	never	come	to	know	my	account!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	maiñ	na	jānta	ke	mera	hisāb	kya	hai

englishTranslationText: “Alas,	if	only	it	had	been	just	death.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāaye	kisi	tarah	maut	hi	qissa	chuka	jāti

englishTranslationText: “My	wealth	did	not	in	the	least	benefit	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Mere	kuchh	kām	na	āaya	mera	māl

englishTranslationText: “All	my	power	has	vanished.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Mera	sab	zor	jāta	raha

englishTranslationText: It	will	be	said,	“Seize	him,	and	shackle	him.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Usey	pakdo	phir	usey	tauq	dālo

englishTranslationText: “Then	hurl	him	into	the	blazing	fire.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	usey	bhadakti	āag		meiñ	dhañsāo.

arabicText: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍۢ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًۭا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
englishTranslationText: “Then	bind	him	inside	a	chain	which	is	seventy	arm-lengths.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	aisi	zanjeer	meiñ	jiska	nāp	sattar	hāth	hai	usey	piro	do

arabicText: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
englishTranslationText: “Indeed	he	refused	to	accept	faith	in	Allah,	the	Greatest.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		woh	azmat	wāle	Allah	par	imān	na	lāta	tha

englishTranslationText: “And	did	not	urge	to	feed	the	needy.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	miskeen	ko	khāna	dene	ki	raghbat	na	deta

englishTranslationText:
“So	he	does	not	have	any	friend	here	this	
day.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	āaj	yahāñ	uska	koi	dost	nahi

englishTranslationText:
“Nor	any	food	except	the	pus	discharged	
from	the	people	of	hell.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	na	kuch	khāne	ko	magar	dozakhiyoñ	
ka	peep.

englishTranslationText: “Which	none	except	the	guilty	shall	eat.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Isey	na	khayeñ	ge	magar	khatā-kār

englishTranslationText: So	by	oath	of	the	things	you	see.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	mujhe	qasam	un	cheezoñ	ki	jinheiñ	tum	
dekhte	ho.

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	those	you	do	not	see.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jinheiñ	tum	nahi	dekhte

englishTranslationText:
This	Qur’an	is	the	speech	of	Allah	with	a	
gracious	Noble	Messenger.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		yeh	Qur’ān	ek	karam	wāle	Rasool	
se	bāteiñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍۢ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	not	the	speech	of	a	poet;	how	little	
do	you	believe!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	kisi	shā’ir	ki	bāt	nahi kitna	kam	
yaqeen	rakhte	ho

arabicText: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍۢ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Nor	is	it	the	speech	of	a	soothsayer;	how	
little	do	you	ponder!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	na	kisi	kāhin	ki	bāt	kitna	kam	dhiyān	
karte	ho

englishTranslationText: Sent	down	by	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ne	utāra	hai	jo	sāre	jahān	ka	Rab	hai.

englishTranslationText:
And	had	he	fabricated	just	one	matter	
upon	Us	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	woh	ham	par	ek	bāt	bhi	banā	kar	
kehte

englishTranslationText:
We	would	have	indeed	forcefully	taken	
revenge	from	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Zaroor	ham	un	se	ba-quwwat	badla	lete.

englishTranslationText: Then	would	have	cut	off	his	heart’s	artery
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	ham	unki	rag-e-dil	kāt	dete

arabicText: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَـٰجِزِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	none	among	you	would	be	his	
saviour.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	tum	meiñ	koi	unka	bachāne	wāla	na	
hota.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	this	Qur’an	is	an	advice	for	the	
pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	yeh	Qur’ān	dar	waloñ		ko	
nasihat	hai.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	know	that	some	among	
you	are	deniers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zaroor	ham	jānte	haiñ	ke	tum	meiñ	
kuchh	jhutlāne	wāle	haiñ

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	it	is	a	despair	for	the	
disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	woh	kāfiroñ		par	hasrat	hai

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	it	is	a	certain	Truth.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	woh	yaqeeni	haq	hai

englishTranslationText:
Therefore	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	proclaim	the	purity	of	
your	Lord,	the	Greatest.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	aey	Mehboob!	Tum	apne	azmat	wāle	
Rab	ki	pāki	bolo
